results.title: A Banking career
results.creator_credit: Harley H. Davidson, Frederick Daniel and Artransa Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the various functions of a bank; the daily routine of business, and the responsibility of various bank officers. The latter part of the film lists the various advantages of making banking a career, mentioning rates of pay, special bonuses, opportunities for advancement, medical and sick leave benefits, pensions on retirement and the social life among bank personnel.

results.title: Tom Arthur
results.creator_credit: National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Tom Arthur’s art is for him a visual way of reasoning. By using the associated symbolic meanings and cultural connotations attached to specific objects and images he attempts to examine and question belief structures and systems of knowledge and how society forces these into its members. For Tom Arthur there are no absolutes, and everything seems relative

results.title: Robert Boynes
results.creator_credit: Alan Cole, Ken Otton, Lloyd Carrick and Robert Lindsay
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Robert Boynes is often grouped with a number of Australian artists who, working from the mid 1960’s, are referred to as “Australian Pop” artists. Australian pop has its own distinct flavour, different from the U.S. and U.K. schools, and related to the Australian environment

results.title: November = Novembre
results.creator_credit: Robert Nichol, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A hundred and one lingering, luminous impressions of the month when the ripe fullness of the Canadian autumn wilts and the whole earth seems to settle into brooding calm. This is a cine-poem, reflecting the somber moods of November, the still, waiting separateness when the Canadian year dawdles, hangs back from the hour when the first snowfall will make all things even. But from the muted tones of the dying season emerges a new, stark beauty. Film without words. (Contains images of duck hunting and animial skinning that may offend some viewers.)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Nichol, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Silent speech (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Horizon”.
A study of non-verbal communication in young children featuring the work of biologist Prof. Hubert Montagner who has discovered a correlation between the behavior of children and the attitudes of the mother toward the child. He also suggests that physiological changes in the mother - specifically the level of various hormones - are mirrored in the child. Made by British Boradcasting Corporation.

results.title: Leave it to the chimneys
results.creator_credit: Anti Cancer Council and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Seeks to educate the viewer about the hazards of cigarette smoking. Animation and medical photography reveal what smoking can do to the lungs. Directed towards young teenagers who may be making up their minds about whether they should smoke or not. No other credits available.
results.description: Seeks to educate the viewer about the hazards of cigarette smoking. Animation and medical photography reveal what smoking can do to the lungs. Directed towards young teenagers who may be making up their minds about whether they should smoke or not. No other credits available.

results.title: For the love of a child
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: This film explores and examines natural childbirth and how it is being accepted. The film shows a Childbirth Education Class at work. These classes are teaching women to understand and control what is happening to their bodies during childbirth, and it involves fathers to be.

results.title: C.E.P. What's that Got to Do with Being Here?
results.brief_description: The C.E.P. (Country Education Project) is an innovative body designed to tackle the industrial needs of rural communities. The projects are either school or community based, depending on individual educational requirements, and have a full-time regional co-ordinator. Outlines the C.E.P. philosophy and takes a close look at programs currently operating in the Ovens and King Valley regions of Victoria.
